issue.title: "TypeError: cannot pickle '_magnum.Color4' object" when running benchmark.py in v0.2.5
issue.body:
Hi there,

I'm trying to run the benchmarking script [here](https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim/blob/v0.2.5/examples/benchmark.py) in v0.2.5 and I'm getting the following error. 

`TypeError: cannot pickle '_magnum.Color4' object`

Unfortunately, don't get more detail in the error message thought it seems to be because of multiprocessing and removing the multiprocessing here: https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim/blob/c8887c8cf421b6df2d77489d42f4e20488e184eb/examples/demo_runner.py#L391-L395

seems to make it work. 

For completeness, here's my setup
habitat-sim v0.2.5 installed from source. 
Ubuntu 18.04
Python 3.9 and Cuda version 11.7.

comment.body:
FYI, this should be implemented with https://github.com/mosra/magnum-bindings/commit/f561337caa9094c4a99411fac402342343f4ecb4, however I don't have an easy way to verify that it indeed works in the full context of Habitat. 

Assuming #2243 is included in your working copy, it should be enough to just pull the submodule in `src/deps/magnum-bindings` to this commit to get the change and check.

issue.title: Plugins missing when using Habitat sim via the C++ interfaces
issue.body:
## Habitat-Sim version
v0.2.5

## ❓ Questions and Help
I am using Habitat sim via the C++ interfaces. However when calling the `esp::sim::Simulator` constructor, an exception is thrown:
```
PluginManager::Manager::setPreferredPlugins(): ObjImporter is not a known alias
```

It seems the plugins are statically compiled, but when inspecting the `AbstractManager`, the `_state->plugins` and `_state->aliases` are empty. The `AssimpImporter` plugin is built from `MagnumPlugins` and `importStaticPlugin.cpp` is compiled and from what I can tell linked correctly. So static plugins should automatically be registering themselves, but for some reason they are not.

Am I missing something or not initialising something correctly?

For reference I have added habitat sim to my C++ project via cmake FetchContent:

```cmake
include(FetchContent)
FetchContent_Declare(
	habitat_sim
	GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim.git
	GIT_TAG        v0.2.5
)
set(BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS OFF)
set(BUILD_DATATOOL OFF)
set(BUILD_GUI_VIEWERS OFF)
set(BUILD_WITH_BULLET ON)
set(BUILD_WEB_APPS OFF)
set(BUILD_WITH_BACKGROUND_RENDERER ON)
set(BUILD_WITH_CUDA OFF)
set(MAGNUM_BUILD_PLUGINS_STATIC ON) # not sure if this is required, tried it with and without
set(CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP0072 NEW) # use glvnd if available
set(CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP0077 NEW) # dont ignore variables already set when a new option is defined
FetchContent_Populate(habitat_sim)
add_subdirectory(${habitat_sim_SOURCE_DIR}/src ${habitat_sim_BINARY_DIR} EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL)

add_library(test_lib STATIC
  src/test.cpp
)

target_link_libraries(test_lib
PUBLIC
  Threads::Threads
PRIVATE
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:agent>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:assets>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:assimp>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:scene>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:core>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:geo>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:gfx>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:metadata>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:io>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:nav>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:sensor>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:physics>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:sim>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:MagnumPlugins::AssimpImporter> # tried with and without
)

add_executable(test
  main.cpp
)

target_link_libraries(test
PUBLIC
  test_lib
)
```
I use the following code in test.cpp:

```cpp
static esp::logging::LoggingContext g_loggin_context;

void test_sim() {
  esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration sim_config;
  sim_config.enablePhysics = true;
  sim_ = std::make_unique<esp::sim::Simulator>(sim_config); // <- throws here
  // do stuff
}
```
The call stack when the exception is thrown is as follows:
```
libc.so.6!pthread_kill (Unknown Source:0)
libc.so.6!raise (Unknown Source:0)
libc.so.6!abort (Unknown Source:0)
Corrade::PluginManager::AbstractManager::setPreferredPlugins(Corrade::PluginManager::AbstractManager * const this, const Corrade::Containers::StringView alias, const Corrade::Containers::StringIterable & plugins) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/deps/corrade/src/Corrade/PluginManager/AbstractManager.cpp:484)
esp::assets::ResourceManager::buildImporters(esp::assets::ResourceManager * const this) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/assets/ResourceManager.cpp:125)
esp::assets::ResourceManager::ResourceManager(esp::assets::ResourceManager * const this, esp::metadata::MetadataMediator::ptr _metadataMediator) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/assets/ResourceManager.cpp:117)
std::make_unique<esp::assets::ResourceManager, std::shared_ptr<esp::metadata::MetadataMediator>&>() (/usr/include/c++/11/bits/unique_ptr.h:962)
esp::sim::Simulator::reconfigure(esp::sim::Simulator * const this, const esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration & cfg) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/sim/Simulator.cpp:115)
esp::sim::Simulator::Simulator(esp::sim::Simulator * const this, const esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration & cfg, esp::metadata::MetadataMediator::ptr _metadataMediator) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/sim/Simulator.cpp:56)
std::make_unique<esp::sim::Simulator, esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration&>() (/usr/include/c++/11/bits/unique_ptr.h:962)
```

comment.body: Can you try linking the plugin to the final executable instead of the library, or putting it to an `INTERFACE` section instead of `PRIVATE`? That should work I think.

pull_request.title: Update Magnum to latest
pull_request.body:
## Motivation and Context

Update of the Magnum submodules containing changes from the last 4+ months.

- The Basis plugins now use a Zstd submodule instead of a heavily outdated build bundled with Basis itself. It should be significantly faster and more secure also. (Actually, it seems that Zstd wasn't actually present in the repo before, which means UASTC files probably never worked? Now they will.)
- Debug performance improvements for [EnumSet](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1EnumSet.html), [StridedArrayView](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1StridedArrayView.html), [BitArray](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1BitArray.html) / [BitArrayView](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1BasicBitArrayView.html) and [String](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1String.html) containers.
- It's now possible to call [StringView::join()](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1BasicStringView.html#a852ca05678c06ef86d7d5e5d79a7099f) with a `std::vector<std::string>` argument :scream: 
- Reduced dependency on STL headers, in particular `<utility>` and `<tuple>` in more places
- Various fixes for compatibility with newer Emscripten versions
- The [Pointer](https://doc.magnum.graphics/corrade/classCorrade_1_1Containers_1_1Pointer.html) class now checks at compile times that a type is defined on deletion, preventing resource leaks due to the destructor not being called. It also disallows conversion to non-trivial/non-virtual bases, where a resource leak would happen due to the derived class destructor not being called.
- `Math::angle()` for quaternions was deprecated as it's actually returning a half-angle. [Math::halfAngle()](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/namespaceMagnum_1_1Math.html#aedc37065c5dad676c5dd5f10cc54f82c) should be used now instead as it's named appropriately (and `math.half_angle()` in case of Python), an `angle()` function returning a full angle will be reintroduced after enough time passes to make sure it doesn't change behavior of existing code.
- [Trade::MeshData](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1MeshData.html) and the [GltfImporter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1GltfImporter.html) now support meshes with morph targets.
- Working around a bug in Qualcomm Adreno drivers (Oculus Quest, e.g.) causing shaders to be silently miscompiled, not displaying anything
- Adapted detection of certain WebGL extensions to changes in their names
- Worked around some more cases where containers using `T{}` didn't work with classes that had a base with an explicit constructor.
- Recognizing the `NV_geometry_shader_passthrough` extension
- [Near/far plane distance queries in Matrix4](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Math_1_1Matrix4.html#aaa4ce31fd0d85bc2c40fd877b00b0910)
- [Ability to draw a sub-range of an indexed GL::Mesh](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1GL_1_1Mesh.html#a1691e32b1b771faf96de56d6cbcdd475) without having to create a temporary `GL::MeshView`
- [Platform::GlfwApplication](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Platform_1_1GlfwApplication.html) now emits a viewport event when moving the windows across macOS displays with different DPI. Note that this *isn't* a complete support for DPI change events across all platforms, that's still quite far ahead.
- [GltfSceneConverter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1GltfSceneConverter.html) now preserves PBR materials even if they're empty, instead of removing them
- [BasisImporter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1BasisImporter.html) and [KtxImporter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1KtxImporter.html) now warn if the file is missing orientation metadata, to aid with debugging asset errors
- Improved test coverage for [JpegImageConverter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1JpegImageConverter.html) and [PngImageConverter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1PngImageConverter.html)
- Support for more legacy formats in [DdsImporter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1DdsImporter.html), especially to be found in various FBX files
- Emscripten support in [OpenExrImporter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1OpenExrImporter.html) and [OpenExrImageConverter](https://doc.magnum.graphics/magnum/classMagnum_1_1Trade_1_1OpenExrImageConverter.html), in particular correct exception handling when a file fails to be parsed
- Other changes, unrelated to Habitat.

## How Has This Been Tested

:green_book:

labels.description: Do not delete this pull request or issue due to inactivity.

issue.title: Plugins missing when using Habitat sim via the C++ interfaces
issue.body:
## Habitat-Sim version
v0.2.5

## ❓ Questions and Help
I am using Habitat sim via the C++ interfaces. However when calling the `esp::sim::Simulator` constructor, an exception is thrown:
```
PluginManager::Manager::setPreferredPlugins(): ObjImporter is not a known alias
```

It seems the plugins are statically compiled, but when inspecting the `AbstractManager`, the `_state->plugins` and `_state->aliases` are empty. The `AssimpImporter` plugin is built from `MagnumPlugins` and `importStaticPlugin.cpp` is compiled and from what I can tell linked correctly. So static plugins should automatically be registering themselves, but for some reason they are not.

Am I missing something or not initialising something correctly?

For reference I have added habitat sim to my C++ project via cmake FetchContent:

```cmake
include(FetchContent)
FetchContent_Declare(
	habitat_sim
	GIT_REPOSITORY https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim.git
	GIT_TAG        v0.2.5
)
set(BUILD_PYTHON_BINDINGS OFF)
set(BUILD_DATATOOL OFF)
set(BUILD_GUI_VIEWERS OFF)
set(BUILD_WITH_BULLET ON)
set(BUILD_WEB_APPS OFF)
set(BUILD_WITH_BACKGROUND_RENDERER ON)
set(BUILD_WITH_CUDA OFF)
set(MAGNUM_BUILD_PLUGINS_STATIC ON) # not sure if this is required, tried it with and without
set(CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP0072 NEW) # use glvnd if available
set(CMAKE_POLICY_DEFAULT_CMP0077 NEW) # dont ignore variables already set when a new option is defined
FetchContent_Populate(habitat_sim)
add_subdirectory(${habitat_sim_SOURCE_DIR}/src ${habitat_sim_BINARY_DIR} EXCLUDE_FROM_ALL)

add_library(test_lib STATIC
  src/test.cpp
)

target_link_libraries(test_lib
PUBLIC
  Threads::Threads
PRIVATE
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:agent>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:assets>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:assimp>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:scene>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:core>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:geo>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:gfx>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:metadata>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:io>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:nav>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:sensor>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:physics>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:sim>
  $<BUILD_INTERFACE:MagnumPlugins::AssimpImporter> # tried with and without
)

add_executable(test
  main.cpp
)

target_link_libraries(test
PUBLIC
  test_lib
)
```
I use the following code in test.cpp:

```cpp
static esp::logging::LoggingContext g_loggin_context;

void test_sim() {
  esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration sim_config;
  sim_config.enablePhysics = true;
  sim_ = std::make_unique<esp::sim::Simulator>(sim_config); // <- throws here
  // do stuff
}
```
The call stack when the exception is thrown is as follows:
```
libc.so.6!pthread_kill (Unknown Source:0)
libc.so.6!raise (Unknown Source:0)
libc.so.6!abort (Unknown Source:0)
Corrade::PluginManager::AbstractManager::setPreferredPlugins(Corrade::PluginManager::AbstractManager * const this, const Corrade::Containers::StringView alias, const Corrade::Containers::StringIterable & plugins) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/deps/corrade/src/Corrade/PluginManager/AbstractManager.cpp:484)
esp::assets::ResourceManager::buildImporters(esp::assets::ResourceManager * const this) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/assets/ResourceManager.cpp:125)
esp::assets::ResourceManager::ResourceManager(esp::assets::ResourceManager * const this, esp::metadata::MetadataMediator::ptr _metadataMediator) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/assets/ResourceManager.cpp:117)
std::make_unique<esp::assets::ResourceManager, std::shared_ptr<esp::metadata::MetadataMediator>&>() (/usr/include/c++/11/bits/unique_ptr.h:962)
esp::sim::Simulator::reconfigure(esp::sim::Simulator * const this, const esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration & cfg) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/sim/Simulator.cpp:115)
esp::sim::Simulator::Simulator(esp::sim::Simulator * const this, const esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration & cfg, esp::metadata::MetadataMediator::ptr _metadataMediator) (/home/dev/test/build/Debug/_deps/habitat_sim-src/src/esp/sim/Simulator.cpp:56)
std::make_unique<esp::sim::Simulator, esp::sim::SimulatorConfiguration&>() (/usr/include/c++/11/bits/unique_ptr.h:962)
```

issue.title: Failed to get EGL display
issue.body:
When I try executing following command:
```habitat-viewer /path/to/data/scene_datasets/habitat-test-scenes/skokloster-castle.glb```
I get following error:
```
EGL: Failed to get EGL display: Success
Platform::GlfwApplication::tryCreate(): cannot create a window with core OpenGL context, falling back to compatibility context
EGL: Failed to get EGL display: Success
Platform::GlfwApplication::tryCreate(): cannot create a window with OpenGL context
```

Can you help me solve it?
Thanks

comment.body:
@0mdc :
I had installed `ibglvnd-dev` when this error occurred. Unfortunately, even after setting the environment variables export `MAGNUM_LOG=verbose` and `MAGNUM_GPU_VALIDATION=ON`, the issue still persists.

There is one peculiar thing. I built habitat-sim from source, and when I run `./build/viewer data/scene_datasets/habitat-test-scenes/skokloster-castle.glb`, it works fine without any problems. It returns:
```
Platform::GlfwApplication: virtual DPI scaling 1
Renderer: Mesa Intel(R) Xe Graphics (TGL GT2) by Intel
OpenGL version: 4.6 (Core Profile) Mesa 21.2.6
```
It seems that my OpenGL is functioning properly.  Here are some details about my environment, If you need any additional information, please let me know.
```
MAGNUM_LOG=verbose
SHELL=/bin/bash
SESSION_MANAGER=local/linjh:@/tmp/.ICE-unix/1725,unix/linjh:/tmp/.ICE-unix/1725
QT_ACCESSIBILITY=1
COLORTERM=truecolor

XDG_MENU_PREFIX=gnome-
GNOME_DESKTOP_SESSION_ID=this-is-deprecated

CONDA_EXE=/home/linjh/miniconda3/bin/conda
_CE_M=
```

issue.title: Platform::WindowlessEglApplication::tryCreateContext(): unable to find CUDA device 0 among 1 EGL devices in total WindowlessContext: Unable to create windowless context
issue.body:
## ❓ Questions and Help
Hello,

I am trying to set up habitat-sim on a wsl remote Ubuntu-22.04 machine, but when I try to run the simulation I encounter the following error Any help on installation please:

````
eglQueryDevicesEXT(): EGL_BAD_ALLOC error: In eglQueryDevicesEXT: Failed to allocate device list.
eglQueryDevicesEXT(): EGL_BAD_ALLOC error: In eglQueryDevicesEXT: Failed to allocate device list.
Platform::WindowlessEglApplication: eglQueryDeviceStringEXT(EGLDevice=0): EGL_MESA_device_software EGL_EXT_device_drm_render_node
eglQueryDeviceAttribEXT(): eglQueryDeviceAttribEXT
Platform::WindowlessEglApplication::tryCreateContext(): unable to find CUDA device 0 among 1 EGL devices in total
WindowlessContext: Unable to create windowless context
````
Ubuntu-22.04 with NVIDIA GPU3090. about via wsl in Windows 10

Steps to reproduce
Install habitat-sim:
conda env create -n habitat python=3.8 cmake=3.14.0
conda start habitat
conda install -n habitat habitat-sim -c conda-forge -c aihabitat
Download and run example: cloned the examples/example.py repo and downloaded the test data. Execute
python examples/example.py --scene . /test_data/scene_datasets/habitat-test-scenes/skokloster-castle.glb

After running nvidia-smi.
```
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| NVIDIA-SMI 530.41.03 Driver Version: 531.41 CUDA Version: 12.1 |
|-----------------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+
| GPU Name Persistence-M| Bus-Id Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr.
| Fan Temp Perf Pwr:Usage/Cap| Memory-Usage | GPU-Util Compute M. | | | MIG M. | GPU Name Persistence-M| Bus-Id Disp.A | Volatile Uncorr.
| MIG M.
| =========================================+======================+======================|
| 0 NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 On | 00000000:02:00.0 On | N/A |
| 0% 47C P8 26W / 370W| 774MiB / 24576MiB | 1% Default |
| | N/A |
+-----------------------------------------+----------------------+----------------------+

+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Processes: |
| GPU GI CI PID Type Process name GPU Memory |
| ID ID Usage |
|=======================================================================================|
| No running processes found |
+---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
```

comment.body: I'll close this as stale. Feel free to file another issue.

issue.title: Failed to get EGL display
issue.body:
When I try executing following command:
```habitat-viewer /path/to/data/scene_datasets/habitat-test-scenes/skokloster-castle.glb```
I get following error:
```
EGL: Failed to get EGL display: Success
Platform::GlfwApplication::tryCreate(): cannot create a window with core OpenGL context, falling back to compatibility context
EGL: Failed to get EGL display: Success
Platform::GlfwApplication::tryCreate(): cannot create a window with OpenGL context
```

Can you help me solve it?
Thanks

comment.body:
@farishajdarpasic , @Jinghan11 :

This hints towards a driver or configuration issue.

I would suggest making sure that your drivers are properly installed and up-to-date. You may also have to install `glvnd` so that the proper OpenGL libs can be found.

If the issue persists, try running Habitat with the environment variables `MAGNUM_GPU_VALIDATION=ON` and `MAGNUM_LOG=verbose`. This should reveal additional information about the issue in the logs.

issue.title: Is headless mode installed by default?

labels.name: support
labels.description: User support requested (e.g. specific issue or API usage question)

issue.body:
Hi, there, 

I'm running in Linux but I don't have NVIDIA GPUs for using headless mode, as described necessary in [this issue](https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim/issues/1511).

I installed habitat-sim using:

`conda install habitat-sim -c conda-forge -c aihabitat
`

After downloading the datasets, I had been trying to run the navigation example in [the Quickstart Page](https://aihabitat.org/docs/habitat-lab/quickstart.html) and I ran into a problem with CUDA, below it follows all the output:

```
pybullet build time: Sep 25 2023 15:30:28
2023-10-04 10:56:32,022 Initializing dataset PointNav-v1
2023-10-04 10:56:44,264 initializing sim Sim-v0
Platform::WindowlessEglApplication::tryCreateContext(): unable to find CUDA device 0 among 2 EGL devices in total
WindowlessContext: Unable to create windowless context
```

Anyone can think of an explanation/a way to solve it?

comment.body:
Hey @MateusLima2801,

Apologize for the late reply. Have you managed to find a solution?

issue.title: issues with 'sim = habitat_sim.Simulator(cfg)'
issue.body:
## Habitat-Sim version
v0.2.2

Habitat is under active development, and we advise users to restrict themselves to stable releases. Are you using the latest [release version](https://github.com/facebookresearch/habitat-sim/releases) of Habitat-Sim? Your question may already be addressed in the latest version. We may also not be able to help with problems in earlier versions because they sometimes lack the more verbose logging needed for debugging.

Main branch contains 'bleeding edge' code and should be used at your own risk.

## Docs and Tutorials
Did you read the docs? https://aihabitat.org/docs/habitat-sim/

Did you check out the tutorials? https://aihabitat.org/tutorial/2020/

Perhaps your question is answered there. If not, carry on!

## ❓ Questions and Help

comment.body:
This is probably due to a driver or configuration issue.

I would suggest verifying that the drivers are properly installed and up-to-date. With NVIDIA, you can use `nvidia-smi` to validate that the driver is installed.

If the issue persists, you can run Habitat with the environment variables `MAGNUM_GPU_VALIDATION=ON` and `MAGNUM_LOG=verbose`. This should reveal additional information about the issue in the logs.

commits.message:
Update Hab3 entries for datasets_download.py (#2245)

* Updates auth requirement for now-public repos and sets hssd-hab version to `main`.

--Docs cleanup (#2238)

* --add gh tag
* --fix ref in doc strings
* --fix more refs in docstrings
Fix rigs not being deleted from the recorder. (#2251)
Increase ambient intensity to make spot and humanoids brighter for P0.
Lighting adjustments.
increase LightSetup ambientIntensity to 0.9
Fix rigs not being deleted from the recorder. (#2251)

pull_request.title: Fix rigs not being deleted from the recorder.
pull_request.body:
## Motivation and Context

A sneaky reference was causing the `rigId` to reset to the default value (`-1`) after the instance record was cleared, causing the removal from internal maps to fail.

## How Has This Been Tested

Tested locally with the sandbox tool humanoid switching.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Docs change / refactoring / dependency upgrade
- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)

## Checklist

- [x] My code follows the code style of this project.
- [x] My change requires a change to the documentation.
- [x] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [x] I have read the **CONTRIBUTING** document.
- [x] I have completed my CLA (see **CONTRIBUTING**)
- [ ] I have added tests to cover my changes.
- [x] All new and existing tests passed.

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: Do not delete this pull request or issue due to inactivity.
